results.title: Days of Heaven
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Siobhan Bowers, Harold Schneider and Terrence Malick
results.brief_description: This visually sumptuous film is the story of three young slum dwellers who are forced to leave Chicago and search for work in the wheat fields of Texas. It is the turn-of-the-century and the depression has created enormous poverty. Bill (Richard Gere) forms a plan to inherit the fortune of his employer, and secure a future for his girlfriend (Brooke Adams) and sister (Linda Manz). This sets in train a chain of deceit and betrayal which leads to tragedy. The cinematography of the stark Texas landscape is by Academy Award winning Nestor Alemandros. The film also stars writer Sam Shepard. Critically “Days of Heaven” has been acclaimed as a leading film of the 1970’s Hollywood “new wave”.

results.title: Day the world ended
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP) and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: B-grade science-fiction from Roger Corman, set in a post-nuclear holocaust world. Just a few survivors are holed up at a ranch (protected from the nuclear fallout by a mountain range) where nerves are frayed and romantic rivalry erupts. These issues are swept aside however when a radioactive mutant creature terrorises the group. Accomplished low budget thriller (reputedly shoot in 9 days) was one of the first to present the horrors of a post-nuclear wasteland — a lawless place, lurking with unpredictable threats. Cast includes: Richard Denning, Lori Nelson, and Jonathan Haze.

results.title: Day of wrath
results.creator_credit: Palladium Films and Carl Theodor Dreyer
results.brief_description: Set in 17th century Europe, “Day of Wrath” is an intense and tragic study of how a young woman is destroyed by the charge of witchcraft. Anne is married to the much older pastor, Absalon Pedersson. She is attracted to her step-son Martin and when Absalon dies of a heart attack, the accusations begin that his death was caused through Anne’s sorcery. Now considered one of the great works of European cinema, “Day of Wrath” is not interested in the occult as much as it explores the psychology of harsh puritanism, especially the debilitating effects of such repression on women. From her initial horror at the accusations, to her remorse and final acceptance, Anne’s story transcends the supernatural and becomes a terrifyingly contemporary study of alienation and emotional betrayal. Based on the play “Anne Pedersdotter” by Wiers Jenssens, Dreyer has reconceived the story and created one of the great feminist works of cinema. Released in Denmark during the Nazi occupation, “Day of Wrath” resonates as a study of terror, hatred and collaboration. With Thorkid Roose, Ilsbeth Movin and Sigrid Neiiendam. In Danish with English subtitles.

results.title: Day of the dead (D)
results.creator_credit: United Film Distribution Company, Laurel Productions, Richard Rubinstein and George A. Romero
results.brief_description: The third and bleakest of George A. Romero’s ‘Living dead’ series (which consist of ‘Night of the living dead’ and ‘Dawn of the dead’), is also the most goriest. Essentially, society has collapsed and the living dead have taken over the world. The film picks up on a small group of survivors, made up of scientists and a small band of soldiers who have barricaded themselves in an abandoned missile silo. The scientists desperately search for a solution to the zombie plague, while the military become increasingly agitated at their lack of results. Like Romero’s previous outings into the world of the undead, the varied groups are microcosms of human nature and not surprisingly, the most unpleasant characters in this film are not the zombies but the humans themselves. Cast includes Lori Cardille, Terry Alexander, Joe Pilato, Richard Liberty and Howard Sherman.

results.title: Davy Crockett: king of the wild frontier
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Bill Walsh and Norman Foster
results.brief_description: Davy Crockett was a legendary folk hero. Starring Fess Parker as Crockett, the hero fights alligators, battles an Indian Chief in a savage tomahawk duel and fights for freedom at the ill-fated Alamo. Accompanied by his friend George Russell, played by Buddy Ebsen, “Davy Crockett” is a daring adventure of drama, humour and excitement and will remain a colourful portrayal of the frontier.

results.title: David Copperfield
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, David O. Selznick and George Cukor
results.brief_description: David Copperfield enjoys an idyllic life with his gentle mother and his loving nurse, Peggotty. Tragedy strikes when Mr Murdstone, a monster of cruelty, weds David’s mother and drives her to an early grave. His adventures from this time introduce us to every stratum of colourful Victorian society. Since its debut in 1935, “David Copperfield” has been acclaimed for its handpicked cast, one that remains unsurpassed to this day. Stars W.C. Fields, Maureen O’Sullivan, Lionel Barrymore, Freddie Bartholomew, May Oliver, Basil Rathbone and over 65 star cast players. Based on the novel by Charles Dickens. Rated: G

results.title: Daughters of the dust [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: American Playhouse Theatrical Films, WMG, Geechee Girls Production and Julie Dash
results.brief_description: At the turn of the century the Peazant family, a multigenerational community threatened with break-up, gathers for a reunion on an island off the coast of South Carolina, historically a place of entry for the European slave ships and a haven for self-emancipated Africans and indigenous peoples. Structured around the twin narratives of Nana, born into slavery, and that of the Unborn Child, this is a rites-of-passage story invoking Islam, Christianity and West African spiritual customs. It is not narrative-driven in the Western mode but is balletic, operatic, non-linear and based on the African oral tradition of the Griot (story-teller), drawing on the Gullah dialect. Dash was also inspired by the literature of African-American women writers. Cast includes Adisa Anderson, Cora Lee Day, Alva Rogers, Barbara-0 and Trula Hoosier.

results.title: Daughters of darkness = The Promise of red lips = The Red lips = Le Rouge aux levres
results.creator_credit: Showking Films, Maya Films, Henry Lange, Paul Collet and Harry Kumel
results.brief_description: In the lost space of an opulent Ostend hotel, eerily deserted in the off season, a young but hardly innocent couple on their honeymoon encounter the apparently ageless, sunlight-fearing, lesbian Countess Bathory. Kumel imaginatively balances the erotic malaise and violence of vampire folklore and a European (specifically Belgian) surrealist tradition with thirties Hollywood camp and comic strip tableaux. Perverse sexuality is located in a setting of decadent highlife which seems to immobilise the “victims”. Originally titled “La Rogue aux Levres” (Lips of Blood). Cast includes John Karlen, Delphine Seyrig, Danielle Ouimet and Andrea Rau.

results.title: Dating the enemy
results.creator_credit: Total Films, Sue Milliken and Megan Simpson
results.brief_description: Guy Pearce and Claudia Karvan star in this comedy which looks at the battle between the sexes from a new perspective. Brett and Tash fall in love but when a lack of compromise threatens their relationship, the forces of the universe intervene. One day they awake to find themselves prisoners in each other’s bodies. Brett learns that being a woman, particularly Tash, presents its own challenges, while Tash learns more than she had bargained for about the male psyche.

results.title: Darling
results.creator_credit: Embassy Pictures Corporation (US), Joseph Janni and John Schlesinger
results.brief_description: Julie Christie won an Academy Award for her performance as an ambitious young model who uses all her assets to achieve social successs. Ultimately, she finds that the life to which she aspired is meaningless and empty. Her relationships with journalist Dirk Bogarde, company director Laurence Harvey, an effeminate photographer and an Italian Prince are never really satisfying. “Darling” was groundbreaking in its time because it exposed the “swinging 60’s” with its more “modern” attitudes towards sexuality, homosexuality and infidelity in a frank and adult manner. The viewer may be left feeling that Christie’s character is shallow and cold despite her vulnerabilty, and that the emptiness of her life is of her own making.
